main event: On 23 April 1949 at approximately 5:45 P.M., an observer sighted a very large, sausage-like object in the sky NE of Tucson, Arizona, which faded from view after about 12 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a city block, reflecting sunlight and following a curved trajectory,The observer noted two circular holes that resembled eyes,The object emitted no sound, had no exhaust trails, and made no identifiable marks,Multiple witnesses confirmed seeing similar objects around the same time,The sighting raised questions regarding the classification of aerial phenomena.
witness description: Observers included a horse-shoer, a caretaker, and a florist, considered reliable by the investigatory team.
